00052 /*============================================================================*/
00053 /* Local data definitions.                                                    */

00056 /*
00057  * Command identifiers.
00058  */
00059 #define COMMAND_SESSIONS        1
00060 #define COMMAND_KEYS            2
00061 #define COMMAND_CONNECT         3
00062 #define COMMAND_DISCONNECT      4
00063 #define COMMAND_CLOSE           5
00064 #define COMMAND_WRITE           6
00065 #define COMMAND_READ            7
00066 #define COMMAND_FLUSH           8
00067 #define COMMAND_ALGORITHMS  9
00068 #define COMMAND_DH_PARAMS       10
00069 #define COMMAND_STATISTICS      11
00070 
00071 /*
00072  * All available commands to llp module.
00073  */
00074 static command_t commands[] = {
00075         {COMMAND_SESSIONS, "sessions", 
00076                         "[sessions]. Show session status."},
00077         {COMMAND_ALGORITHMS, "algorithms", 
00078                         "[algorithms <level>]. Show session algorithms."},
00079         {COMMAND_DH_PARAMS, "dh", 
00080                         "[dh <session_id>]. Show diffie-hellman parameters."},
00081         {COMMAND_KEYS, "keys", 
00082                         "[keys <session_id>]. Show session keys."},
00083         {COMMAND_STATISTICS, "statistics", 
00084                         "[statistics]. Show sessions statistics."},
00085         {COMMAND_CONNECT, "connect", 
00086                         "[connect <ip> <port>]. Establish a new session to other host."},
00087         {COMMAND_DISCONNECT, "disconnect", 
00088                         "[disconnect <session_id>]. Finalize an established session."},
00089         {COMMAND_CLOSE, "close", 
00090                         "[close <session_id>]. Abort abruptly an established session."},
00091         {COMMAND_WRITE, "write", 
00092                         "[write <session_id> <msg>]. Send a message through a session."},
00093         {COMMAND_READ, "read", 
00094                         "[read <session_id>]. Reads a message from a session."},
00095         {COMMAND_FLUSH, "flush", 
00096                         "[flush]. Disposes all enqueued messages."},
00097 };
00098 
00099 /*
00100  * console interface struct.
00101  */
00102 static layer_console_t layer_console;

00108 /*
00109  * Returns the command list of this console.
00110  * 
00111  * @command_arg exit parameter used to return command list.
00112  * @size exit parameter used to return command_arg size.
00113  */
00114 static void console_get_command_list(command_t **command_arg, int *size);
00115 
00116 /*
00117  * Executes a command of the layer.
00118  * 
00119  * @param out_buffer buffer to write output over it.
00120  * @param out_buffer size of the output buffer.
00121  * @function_id the function id to be executed.
00122  * @args argument to the function.
00123  */
00124 static void console_execute_command(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len,
00125                 int function_id, char *args);
00126 
00127 /*
00128  * Concatenates the format string to the out buffer.
00129  * 
00130  * @param out The out buffer. The format string will be concatenated to this
00131  *              parameter.
00132  * @param buffer_len Maximum length allowed to write at out buffer.
00133  * @param format The format string.
00134  * @param ... The arguments to the format string.
00135  */
00136 static void console_printf(char *out, int buffer_len, const char * format, ...);
00137 
00138 /*
00139  * Cancatenates an hex dump to the out buffer.
00140  * 
00141  * @param out The out buffer. The format string will be concatenated to this
00142  *              parameter.
00143  * @param buffer_len Maximum length allowed to write at out buffer.
00144  * @param data The data to be dumped.
00145  * @param len How many bytes will be dumped from data.
00146  */
00147 static void console_dump(char *out, int buffer_len, u_char *data, int len);
00148

00208 /*
00209  * Translates hostname to a sockaddr_in struct containing ip and port.
00210  * 
00211  * @param address the sockaddr_in struct where the address will be returned.
00212  * @param hostname the hostname string to be resolved.
00213  * @param port the value of the port field.
00214  * @return LLP_ERROR if the name can't be translated, LLP_OK otherwise.
00215  */
00216 static int resolve_name(struct sockaddr_in *address, 
00217                 char *hostname, int port);

00223 layer_console_t *get_console_interface() {
00224         layer_console.console_execute_command = console_execute_command;
00225         layer_console.console_get_command_list = console_get_command_list;      
00226         return &layer_console;
00227 }

00230 /* Local functions implementations.                                           */

00232 
00233 void console_get_command_list(command_t **command_arg, int *size) {
00234         *command_arg = commands;
00235         *size = sizeof(commands);
00236 }
00237 /******************************************************************************/
00238 void console_execute_command(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, 
00239                 int function_id, char *args) {
00240         switch (function_id) {
00241                 case COMMAND_SESSIONS:
00242                         console_print_sessions(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00243                         break;
00244                 case COMMAND_STATISTICS:
00245                         console_print_statistics(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00246                         break;
00247                 case COMMAND_ALGORITHMS:
00248                         console_print_algorithms(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00249                         break;
00250                 case COMMAND_DH_PARAMS:
00251                         console_print_dh_params(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00252                         break;
00253                 case COMMAND_KEYS:
00254                         console_print_keys(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00255                         break;
00256                 case COMMAND_CONNECT:
00257                         console_connect(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00258                         break;
00259                 case COMMAND_DISCONNECT:
00260                         console_disconnect(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00261                         break;
00262                 case COMMAND_CLOSE:
00263                         console_close_session(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00264                         break;
00265                 case COMMAND_WRITE:
00266                         console_write_data(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00267                         break;
00268                 case COMMAND_READ:
00269                         console_read_data(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00270                         break;
00271                 case COMMAND_FLUSH:
00272                         console_flush(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00273                         break;
00274         }
00275 }
00276 /******************************************************************************/
00277 void console_print_sessions(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00278         int i;
00279         struct in_addr ip;
00280         
00281         out_buffer[0] = '\0';
00282         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00283                         "%-10s %-10s %21s %20s  %-10s %-10s\n", 
00284                         "Local #",
00285                         "Foreign #",
00286                         "Foreign Address",
00287                         "State",
00288                         "Timeout",
00289                         "Silent");
00290         for (i = 0; i < LLP_MAX_SESSIONS; i++) {
00291 
00292                 llp_lock_session(i);
00293 
00294                 if (llp_sessions[i].state != LLP_STATE_CLOSED) {
00295                         ip = llp_sessions[i].address.sin_addr;
00296                         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00297                                         "%-10d %-10d %15s:%-5d %20s  %-10d %-10d\n", 
00298                                         i, 
00299                                         llp_sessions[i].foreign_session,
00300                                         inet_ntoa(ip),
00301                                         ntohs(llp_sessions[i].address.sin_port),
00302                                         llp_states[llp_sessions[i].state],
00303                                         (llp_sessions[i].timeout*LLP_TIME_TICK)/1000,
00304                                         (llp_sessions[i].silence*LLP_TIME_TICK)/1000);
00305                 }
00306                 
00307                 llp_unlock_session(i);
00308         }
00309 }
00310 /******************************************************************************/
00311 void console_print_statistics(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00312         int i;
00313         struct in_addr ip;
00314         
00315         out_buffer[0] = '\0';
00316         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "%-10s %-10s %-10s %-10s\n", 
00317                         "Local #",
00318                         "Foreign #",
00319                         "Sent",
00320                         "Recv");
00321         for (i = 0; i < LLP_MAX_SESSIONS; i++) {
00322 
00323                 llp_lock_session(i);
00324 
00325                 if (llp_sessions[i].state == LLP_STATE_ESTABLISHED) {
00326                         ip = llp_sessions[i].address.sin_addr;
00327                         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00328                                         "%-10d %-10d %-10d %-10d\n", 
00329                                         i,
00330                                         llp_sessions[i].foreign_session,
00331                                         llp_sessions[i].packets_sent,
00332                                         llp_sessions[i].packets_received);
00333                 }
00334                 
00335                 llp_unlock_session(i);
00336         }
00337 }
00338 /******************************************************************************/
00339 void console_print_algorithms(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00340         int i;
00341         struct in_addr ip;
00342         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "%-8s %-10s %s\n", 
00343                         "Local #",
00344                         "Foreign #",
00345                         "cipher(block size):hash:mac(length)");
00346                         
00347         for (i = 0; i < LLP_MAX_SESSIONS; i++) {
00348                 
00349                 llp_lock_session(i);
00350                 
00351                 if (llp_sessions[i].state == LLP_STATE_ESTABLISHED) {
00352                         ip = llp_sessions[i].address.sin_addr;
00353                         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00354                                         "%-8d %-10d   %s(%d):%s:%s(%d)\n", 
00355                                         i, 
00356                                         llp_sessions[i].foreign_session,
00357                                         llp_sessions[i].cipher->name,
00358                                         llp_sessions[i].cipher->block_size,
00359                                         llp_sessions[i].hash->name,
00360                                         llp_sessions[i].mac->name,
00361                                         llp_sessions[i].mac->length);
00362                 }
00363                 
00364                 llp_unlock_session(i);
00365         }
00366 }
00367 /******************************************************************************/
00368 void console_print_dh_params(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00369         int session;
00370         char *tok;
00371         char *endptr;
00372         
00373         tok = strtok(args, " \n");
00374         if (tok == NULL) {
00375                 return;
00376         }
00377 
00378         session = strtol(tok, &endptr, 10);
00379         if (*tok=='\0' || *endptr!='\0') {
00380                 return;
00381         }
00382 
00383         llp_lock_session(session);
00384         
00385         if (llp_sessions[session].state == LLP_STATE_ESTABLISHED) {
00386                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   y_in:");
00387                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00388                                 llp_sessions[session].y_in, 
00389                                 MPINT_LENGTH(llp_sessions[session].y_in) + MPINT_SIZE_LENGTH);
00390                                 
00391                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   y_out:");
00392                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00393                                 llp_sessions[session].y_out, 
00394                                 MPINT_LENGTH(llp_sessions[session].y_out) + MPINT_SIZE_LENGTH);
00395                                 
00396                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   z:");
00397                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00398                                 llp_sessions[session].z, 
00399                                 MPINT_LENGTH(llp_sessions[session].z) + MPINT_SIZE_LENGTH);
00400                                 
00401                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   h_in:");
00402                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00403                                 llp_sessions[session].h_in, 
00404                                 LLP_H_LENGTH);
00405                                 
00406                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   h_out:");
00407                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00408                                 llp_sessions[session].h_out, 
00409                                 LLP_H_LENGTH);
00410                                 
00411                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   close_verifier:");
00412                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00413                                 llp_sessions[session].verifier, 
00414                                 llp_sessions[session].hash->length);
00415         } else {
00416                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "session not established yet\n");
00417         }
00418         
00419         llp_unlock_session(session);
00420 }
00421 /******************************************************************************/
00422 void console_print_keys(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00423         int session;
00424         char *tok;
00425         char *endptr;
00426         
00427         tok = strtok(args, " \n");
00428         if (tok == NULL) {
00429                 return;
00430         }
00431 
00432         session = strtol(tok, &endptr, 10);
00433         if (*tok=='\0' || *endptr!='\0') {
00434                 return;
00435         }
00436         
00437         llp_lock_session(session);
00438 
00439         if (llp_sessions[session].state == LLP_STATE_ESTABLISHED) {
00440                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   cipher_in_key:");
00441                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00442                                 llp_sessions[session].cipher_in_key,
00443                                 llp_sessions[session].cipher->key_length);
00444 
00445                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   cipher_out_key:");
00446                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00447                                 llp_sessions[session].cipher_out_key,
00448                                 llp_sessions[session].cipher->key_length);
00449 
00450                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   cipher_in_iv:");
00451                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00452                                 llp_sessions[session].cipher_in_iv,
00453                                 llp_sessions[session].cipher->iv_length);
00454 
00455                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   cipher_out_iv:");
00456                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00457                                 llp_sessions[session].cipher_out_iv,
00458                                 llp_sessions[session].cipher->iv_length);
00459 
00460                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   mac_in_key:");
00461                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00462                                 llp_sessions[session].mac_in_key, 
00463                                 llp_sessions[session].mac->key_length);
00464 
00465                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   mac_out_key:");
00466                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00467                                 llp_sessions[session].mac_out_key, 
00468                                 llp_sessions[session].mac->key_length);
00469         } else {
00470                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "session not established yet\n");
00471         }
00472         
00473         llp_unlock_session(session);
00474 }
00475 /******************************************************************************/
00476 void console_connect(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00477         char *tok;
00478         struct sockaddr_in address;
00479         char *endptr;
00480         char *hostname;
00481         int port;
00482 
00483         tok = strtok(args, ": \n");
00484         if (tok == NULL) {
00485                 return;
00486         }
00487 
00488         hostname = tok; 
00489         
00490         tok = strtok(NULL, " \n");
00491         if (tok == NULL) {
00492                 return;
00493         }
00494 
00495         port = strtol(tok, &endptr, 10);
00496         if (*tok=='\0' || *endptr!='\0') {
00497                 return;
00498         }
00499         
00500         if (resolve_name(&address, hostname, port) == LLP_ERROR) {
00501                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00502                                 "Error cannor resolve hostname: %s.\n", hostname);
00503                 return;
00504         }
00505         
00506         if (llp_connect_to(&address) != LINK_ERROR) {
00507                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "Connection request sent.\n");
00508         } else {
00509                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "Error connecting.\n");
00510         }
00511 }
00512 /******************************************************************************/
00513 void console_disconnect(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00514         char *tok;
00515         char *endptr;
00516         int session;
00517 
00518 
00519         tok = strtok(args, " \n");
00520         if (tok == NULL) {
00521                 return;
00522         }
00523 
00524         session = strtol(tok, &endptr, 10);
00525         if (*tok=='\0' || *endptr!='\0') {
00526                 return;
00527         }
00528         
00529         if (llp_disconnect(session) != LINK_ERROR) {
00530                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "Close request sent.\n");
00531         } else {
00532                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "Error disconnecting.\n");
00533         }       
00534 }
00535 /******************************************************************************/
00536 void console_close_session(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00537         char *tok;
00538         char *endptr;
00539         int session;
00540 
00541 
00542         tok = strtok(args, " \n");
00543         if (tok == NULL) {
00544                 return;
00545         }
00546 
00547         session = strtol(tok, &endptr, 10);
00548         if (*tok=='\0' || *endptr!='\0') {
00549                 return;
00550         }
00551         
00552         llp_close_session(session);
00553         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "Session closed.\n");
00554 }
00555 /******************************************************************************/
00556 void console_write_data(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00557         char *tok;
00558         char *endptr;
00559         int session;
00560 
00561 
00562         tok = strtok(args, " \n");
00563         if (tok == NULL) {
00564                 return;
00565         }
00566 
00567         session = strtol(tok, &endptr, 10);
00568         if (*tok=='\0' || *endptr!='\0') {
00569                 return;
00570         }
00571 
00572         tok = strtok(NULL, " \n");
00573         if (tok == NULL) {
00574                 return;
00575         }
00576         
00577         llp_write(session, (u_char *)tok, strlen(tok)+1);
00578         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "Message sent.\n");
00579 }
00580 /******************************************************************************/
00581 void console_read_data(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00582         int session;
00583         int return_value;
00584         u_char buffer[1000]; // TODO, colocar constante FTU
00585 
00586         return_value = llp_read(&session, buffer, sizeof(buffer));
00587         if (return_value == LINK_ERROR) {
00588                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "Error reading.\n");
00589         } else {
00590                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00591                                 "Message read from session %d.\n", session);
00592                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, buffer, return_value);
00593         }
00594 }
00595 /******************************************************************************/
00596 void console_flush(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00597         int return_value;
00598         
00599         return_value = llp_flush();
00600         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00601                         "Messages flushed: %d.\n", return_value);
00602 }
00603 /******************************************************************************/
00604 int resolve_name(struct sockaddr_in *address, char *hostname, int port) {
00605         struct addrinfo *result;
00606         struct addrinfo hints;
00607         int error;
00608 
00609         /* Only IPv4 addresses supported. */
00610         memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(struct addrinfo));
00611         hints.ai_family = PF_INET;
00612 
00613         error = getaddrinfo(hostname, NULL, &hints, &result);
00614         if (error) {
00615                 return LLP_ERROR;
00616         } else {
00617                 if (result->ai_addrlen == sizeof(struct sockaddr_in)) {
00618                         memcpy(address, result->ai_addr, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
00619                         address->sin_port =     htons(port);
00620                 }
00621                 freeaddrinfo(result);
00622                 return LLP_OK;
00623         }
00624 }
00625 /******************************************************************************/
00626 void console_printf(char *out, int buffer_len, const char * format, ...) {
00627 
00628         char line[100];
00629     va_list ap;
00630 
00631     va_start(ap, format);
00632         vsnprintf(line, sizeof(line), format, ap);
00633     va_end(ap);
00634     
00635     strncat(out, line, buffer_len - strlen(out) - 1);
00636 }
00637 /******************************************************************************/
00638 void console_dump(char *out, int buffer_len, u_char *data, int len) {
00639         int k;  
00640         for(k=0; k<len; k++) {
00641                 if (k%16==0) console_printf(out, buffer_len, "\n");
00642                 console_printf(out, buffer_len, " %02X", data[k]);
00643         }
00644         console_printf(out, buffer_len, "\n");
00645 }
